description:
Your laptop may already have a decent webcam. Most do. Which is why Amazon’s Prime Day is basically a chance for vendors to unload quality webcams with a forklift.

I’m not really exaggerating. The Iskovi C28 webcam is a 1080p webcam, which has become table stakes for the best webcams for your PC. But the Iskovi C28 is just $13.59 on Amazon for Prime Day — that’s a whopping 82 percent off. And it gets better: Amazon will take an additional 8 percent off if you buy two.

Yes, that’s insane. What’s even crazier is that this webcam — which, admittedly, I haven’t reviewed — has a fairly uniform four- and
title: Amazon’s basically giving away this top webcam for 82 percent off

description:
If you’re looking for a modern Thunderbolt dock and don’t want to spend the usual $200 to $300, then here’s a killer Prime Day deal for you: Kensington’s SD2480T is on sale for $60 at Amazon. That’s 67% off!

Yes, this is older hardware. But here’s the deal with Thunderbolt: until the apparently delayed Thunderbolt 5 hardware rolls out next year, Thunderbolt 3 is still an up-to-date standard.

I’ve reviewed dozens of docks for PCWorld since 2020 when the pandemic hit and Thunderbolt docks became the must-have computer peripheral. I maintain PCWorld’s roundups for best Thunderbolt docks,
title: Kensington’s $60 Thunderbolt dock is an insane Prime Day deal

description:
Amazon Prime Day has finally arrived and so has the deluge of epic Prime Day keyboard deals, so if you fancy yourself a keyboard fanatic, you better keep reading!

If you’re looking to pick up a mechanical keyboard for a phenomenal price, you’re in luck because Amazon is now selling the SteelSeries Apex 7 TKL mechanical keyboard for just $70, which is 30 percent off of the original $100 price tag.

In addition to overseeing PCWorld’s laptop coverage, I’m also something of a keyboard snob. I personally own a mechanical keyboard from Corsair that I use every day for work and pla
title: Get this SteelSeries mechanical keyboard for just $70 on Prime Day

title: Macrium Reflect Home 8 review: An exceptional imaging and backup program

description:
Know what would make your life easier? A power bank that magnetizes to the back of your phone for wireless charging! The Anker Magnetic Power Bank is now available for $31.49 on Prime Day instead of the regular $40, making this 10,000mAh is a fantastic choice.

I’ve been in tech media for over 12 years at this point, many of them hunting down the best deals, and this Anker discount is simply fantastic, especially since the power bank is so versatile and useful.

The Anker Magnetic Power Bank has a massive 10,000mAh capacity, which should be enough for about two full charges on your phone. Whether you’re having a fun night out or going on a trip where you won’t have immediate access to a wall outlet, having a small power bank that simply magnetizes to the back of your phone wil
title: This Anker MagSafe Power Bank is cheaper than ever on Prime Day
